div.span: All Spokane Public Schools sites, including preschools, are closed for students for the rest of the 2019-20 school year.

div.h2: For students & families while learning at home

span.a: No school: School Break Day or Emergency Makeup

img.p: Following Governor Inslee’s emergency declaration, all SPS sites, including preschools, are closed for students for the rest of the 2019-20 school year.
Tips & resources for staying busy and calm while not being able to leave the house.
This is the first time in SPS history that four schools will be named at the same time. We need your ideas!
SPS is checking out laptops to our students during the closure based on need and availability.
Resources to support student learning while schools are closed.
BoardDocs houses our school board meeting agendas, minutes, materials, resolutions & more.
The Boundary Adjustment Committee has begun its work. We'll keep you current with meeting minutes and materials.
Professional development for teachers July 20-23 at Ferris HS. Registration is now open!
School calendars for the next three years are now available for your planning purposes.
Thanks to our partnership with Spokane Public Library, all SPS students and staff have free library cards!
With more than 31,000 students and 3,000 staff, SPS has many stories to share. What's happening at your school? Let us know!

div.p: Our T24 goal means that students will be prepared to follow any pathway they desire after graduation, including: military careers, 2-year technical and trade schools, or 4-year colleges and universities.

div.h3: Working to ensure each student is healthy, safe, engaged, supported and challenged.
